SENT.plain: We present a 31-year-old female patient with Behçet's disease
Behcet's disease is a systematic vasculitis of unknown cause involving veins and arteries of all sizes and having reccurent mucocutaneous and frequent ocular involvement
Our patient was suffering from oral and genital ulcers, fever, painful left knee and erythema nodosum
After having excluded differential diagnoses Behçet's disease was diagnosed
The treatment must be individual and it depends on the presence and severity of symptoms
The optimal improvement was observed after treatment with azathioprine, cyclosporine A and metylprednisolon
Behçet's disease is very seldom in our country but perhaps sometimes it isn't good diagnosed
